data.title: New Jersey Society for Respiratory Care
data.meta_description: The New Jersey Society for Respiratory Care (NJSRC) is a chartered affiliate of the American Association for Respiratory Care (AARC). The NJSRC is a non-profit organization with the dedicated purpose of promoting and advancing the art, science, technology, and ethics of respiratory care in the State of New Jersey.
data.meta_site_name: New Jersey Society for Respiratory Care
data.text:
Home

Important Update for CRTs and TERL Holders

On November 20, 2023, New Jersey amended P.L. 1991, c.31, allowing applicants who pass the Certified Respiratory Therapy ("CRT") examination administered by the National Board of Respiratory Care ("NBRC") to apply for a plenary license as a respiratory care therapist in the State of New Jersey. This law expands New Jersey's pool of qualified respiratory care professionals

Read More...

AARC News and Headlines

SOAR Act Introduction

The SOAR Act would establish a new payment methodology for liquid oxygen, and for supplemental oxygen patients to access respiratory therapists. Please advocate for your profession.

Volunteer Manager

This summer, AARC will launch a new Volunteer Manager to help members become more engaged in the association at the state and national level through short- and long-term volunteer opportunities.
